revised_title: The Bergemoletto Snow Disaster: A Remarkable Account of Survival and Rescue
tldr: In 1755, a massive snowfall in Bergemoletto, Italy, buried 24 people under a 60-foot-high snow heap. This article recounts the harrowing experience of the survivors, including a father and son who managed to escape just in time, and the eventual rescue of a wife, sister, and daughter who were found alive after five days buried under the snow.
